MongoDB Aggregations $addFields.description: Adds new field(s) to a document with a computed value, or reassigns an existing field(s) with a computed value.

body: * groupBy: The expression to group by.
* boundaries: An array of the lower boundaries for each bucket.
* default: The bucket name for documents that do not fall within the specified boundaries
*   outputN: Optional. The output object may contain a single or numerous field names used to accumulate values per bucket.
MongoDB Aggregations $bucket.description: Categorizes incoming documents into groups, called buckets, based on specified boundaries.

body: * groupBy: The expression to group by.
* buckets: The desired number of buckets
*   outputN: Optional. The output object may contain a single or numerous field names used to accumulate values per bucket.
MongoDB Aggregations $bucketAuto.description: Automatically categorizes documents into a specified number of buckets, attempting even distribution if possible.

MongoDB Aggregations $collStats.description: Returns statistics regarding a collection or view.

body: * Provide the field name for the count.
MongoDB Aggregations $count.description: Returns a count of the number of documents at this stage of the aggregation pipeline.

body: * field: The required field to densify.
* partitionByFields: The set of fields that acts as a compound key to define each partition.
*   step: The amount to increment the field value in each document.
*   unit: If specified field must evaluate to a date for every document in the collection, otherwise must evaluate to a numeric.
*   bounds: A string or array of numeric/date bounds, corresponding to the type of the field.
MongoDB Aggregations $densify.description: Creates new documents to eliminate the gaps in the time or numeric domain at the required granularity level.

MongoDB Aggregations $documents.description: Returns literal documents from input values.

MongoDB Aggregations $facet.description: Allows for multiple parellel aggregations to be specified.

body: * sortBy: Syntax is the same as \$sort, required if "method" is used in at least one output spec otherwise optional
* partitionBy: Optional, default is a single partition. Specification is the same as _id in \$group (same as partitionBy in window functions).
* partitionByFields: Optional, set of fields that acts as a compound key to define each partition.
* output - Required, object for each field to fill in. For a single field, can be a single object.
* output.<field> - A field to be filled with value, if missing or null in the current document.
MongoDB Aggregations $fill.description: Populates null and missing field values within documents.

body: * near: The point to search near.
* maxDistance: The maximum distance, in meters, documents can be before being excluded from results.
* query: Limits results that match the query
* includeLocs: Optional. Labels and includes the point used to match the document.
* num: Optional. The maximum number of documents to return.
* spherical: Defaults to false. Specifies whether to use spherical geometry.
MongoDB Aggregations $geoNear.description: Returns documents based on proximity to a geospatial point.

body: * as: Name of the array field.
* depthField: Optional Name of the depth field.
MongoDB Aggregations $graphLookup.description: Performs a recursive search on a collection.

MongoDB Aggregations $group.description: Groups documents by a specified expression.

MongoDB Aggregations $indexStats.description: Returns statistics regarding the use of each index for the collection.

body: * Provide the number of documents to limit.
MongoDB Aggregations $limit.description: Limits the number of documents that flow into subsequent stages.

body: * as: The name for the results.
* pipeline: Optional pipeline to run on the foreign collection.
* let: Optional variables to use in the pipeline field stages.
MongoDB Aggregations $lookup.description: Performs a join between two collections.

MongoDB Aggregations $match.description: Filters the document stream to allow only matching documents to pass through to subsequent stages.

body: * atlas: Location to write the documents from the aggregation pipeline.
MongoDB Aggregations $merge.description: Merges the resulting documents into a collection, optionally overriding existing documents.

body: * s3Url: A S3 URL to save the data.
* atlas: Parameters to save to Atlas.
MongoDB Aggregations $out.description: Writes the result of a pipeline to an Atlas cluster or S3 bucket.

MongoDB Aggregations $project.description: Adds new field(s) to a document with a computed value, or reassigns an existing field(s) with a computed value. Unlike $addFields, $project can also remove fields.

MongoDB Aggregations $redact.description: Restricts the content for each document based on information stored in the documents themselves

MongoDB Aggregations $replaceWith.description: Replaces a document with the specified embedded document.

MongoDB Aggregations $replaceRoot.description: Replaces a document with the specified embedded document.

body: * size: The number of documents to sample.
MongoDB Aggregations $sample.description: Randomly selects the specified number of documents from its input.

body: * index: The name of the Search index.
* text: Analyzed search, with required fields of query and path, the analyzed field(s) to search.
* span: Find in text field regions.
* exists: Test for presence of a field.
* near: Find near number or date.
* range: Find in numeric or date range.
MongoDB Aggregations $search.description: Performs a full-text search on the specified field(s).

body: * index: The name of the Search index.
* count: The count of the results.
*   operator: Analyzed search, with required fields of query and path, can either be replaced with the name of a valid operator.
*     stringFacet: Narrows search results based on unique string values, with required fields of type and path.
*     numberFacet: Narrows search results by breaking them up into separate ranges of numbers, with required fields of type, path, and boundaries.
*     dateFacet: Narrows search results by breaking them up into separate ranges of dates, with required fields of type, path, and boundaries.
MongoDB Aggregations $searchMeta.description: Performs a full-text search on the specified field(s) and gets back only the generated search meta data from a query.

MongoDB Aggregations $set.description: Adds new fields to documents. $set outputs documents that contain all existing fields from the input documents and newly added fields.

body: *     function: The window function to compute over the given window.
*       documents: A number of documents before and after the current document.
*       range: A range of possible values around the value in the current document's sortBy field.
*       unit: Specifies the units for the window bounds.
MongoDB Aggregations $setWindowFields.description: Capable of partitioning incoming data, and can apply one or more functions to defined windows within each partition.

body: * Provide the number of documents to skip.
MongoDB Aggregations $skip.description: Skips a specified number of documents before advancing to the next stage.

body: * Provide any number of field/order pairs.
MongoDB Aggregations $sort.description: Reorders the document stream by a specified sort key and direction.

MongoDB Aggregations $sortByCount.description: Groups incoming documents based on the value of a specified expression, then computes the count of documents in each distinct group.

body: * pipeline: The pipeline on the other collection.
MongoDB Aggregations $unionWith.description: Perform a union with a pipeline on another collection.

body: * Provide the field name to exclude.
* To exclude multiple fields, pass the field names in an array.
MongoDB Aggregations $unset.description: Excludes fields from the result document.

body: * path: Path to the array field.
*   toggle to unwind null and empty values.
MongoDB Aggregations $unwind.description: Outputs a new document for each element in a specified array.
